issue.title: [C++] Add StatusCode::OverflowError
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2389](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2389). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It may be useful to have a `StatusCode::OverflowError` return code, to signal that something overflowed allowed limits (e.g. the 2GB limit for string or binary values).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2389?focusedCommentId=16462472) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Another thought: have a `CapacityError` for when a size limit has been reached, and a `OverflowError` for arithmetic overflow.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2389?focusedCommentId=16465808) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
